downloadTitle: System Center 2012 R2 Integration Pack for VMware vSphere
downloadDescription: The Integration Pack for VMware vSphere is an add-on for System Center 2012 R2 - Orchestrator that enables you to connect System Center Orchestrator to your VMware vSphere server to automate actions in VMware vSphere to enable full management of the virtualized computing infrastructure.
detailsSection:
The Integration Pack for VMware vSphere is an add-on for System Center 2012 R2 - Orchestrator that enables you to connect System Center 2012 R2 - Orchestrator to your VMware vSphere server to automate actions in VMware vSphere to enable full management of the virtualized computing infrastructure.

Feature Summary
The Integration Pack includes the following activities:
  • Add Network Adapter
  • Add VM Disk
  • Clone Linux VM
  • Clone Windows VM
  • Create VM
  • Customize VM
  • Delete VM
  • Get Cluster Properties
  • Get Datastore Capacity
  • Get Hosts
  • Get Resource Pool Runtime Info
  • Get Resource Pools
  • Get VM List
  • Get VM Properties
  • Get VM Status
  • Migrate VM
  • Move VM
  • Reconfigure VM
  • Reset VM
  • Revert VM Snapshot
  • Set Guest Info Variables
  • Set VM CD/DVD to ISO Image
  • Set VM Networks
  • Start VM
  • Stop VM
  • Suspend VM
  • Take VM Snapshot
  • Maintenance Mode
  • Get Host Properties
  • Get Host Datastores

Release History
  • 06/26/2016 - Update 2 (version 7.2.105.0) - Included fixes: Allow conversion of this Integration Pack to PowerShell module via System Center Orchestrator Migration Toolkit. The generated PowerShell modules can be used with Azure Automation or Service Management Automation.

  • 04/03/2014 - Update 1 (version 7.2.93.0) - Included fixes: When creating an addtional disk for a VM the resulting .vmdk file will have a GUID incorrectly appended to the name.

  • 10/25/2013 - Original English release, version 7.2.46.0
installInstructionSection:
Download the package and extract the files to your computer by running the .exe.

Then follow the instruction on this page to install Integration Packs: http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/hh420346.aspx
